titleInfo.title: Letter No. 301: Captain Arnold Burrowes Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, to Commodore George Robinson, Commander of the Indian Naval Squadron in the Persian Gulf, Bushire

mods.abstract: This letter concerns a deposition made by a native of Bushire named Ghooloom Ali (also written as Ghooloom Ally), who was until recently in the service of Lieutenant James Longden Stevens. Captain Arnold Burrowes Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, states that the man was severely bastinadoed by order of the Governor, without Kemball's sanction, and was only released after Stevens had intervened on his behalf. Kemball requests information on the degree of interference exercised by Stevens and the nature of the charge that was brought against Ghooloom Ali. Kemball expresses his suspicion that the grounds for punishment were fabricated in order to support a vindictive prosecution. A copy of a statement made by Ghooloom Ali, dated 14 September, is enclosed with this letter.
